Activites.title: Hiking program: nature for people with fewer opportunities related to psychiatric disorders
Activites.needs: There is a need of finding normalized environments that suit their special characteristics. Engagement in apropriate physical activities suited there condion. Handle social stigma and anticipated exclusion. Confusion between people with disabilities due to mental illness and people with intellectual disabilities.
Activites.challenges: The biggest challenge is to open our closest community to include people who live with the symptoms of mental illness in all the activities and initiatives proposed. Therefore, the first step is to make this group of people visible and show their neighbors that they can add value if they have the opportunity to participate.
Activites.stakeholders: The Sport Club Deportivo Duero, the HIKING CLUB ‘Ojanco’ and AEDIR (Spanish Sport Association for Inclusion and Recovery)

indicators.description: Number of routes organized and free seats on each trip
Events outside the club in which participants got involved
Participation in the activities organized by the Ojanco Mountain Club
People who join Duero Club just to participate in the hiking activities
People who become members of external hiking/climbing clubs and Groups who meet independently to walk in the nature

references.title: Club Deportivo Duero
HIKING CLUB ‘Ojanco’

Activites.keySuccessFactors: The only prerequisite is to enjoy walking in the nature. Carrying out activities in the nature has an intrinsic motivation and is an inclusive leisure and free time activities. The previous work and preparation of participants

Activites.title: WORKPLACE WELLNESS: Wellness program - workplace exercise and a healthy food
Activites.targetGroup: Companies that employ people with disabilities and want to raise the level of a healthy work environment, and employees who want to strengthen their health and well-being.
Activites.needs: There is a need to tackle overeating and obesity
Activites.challenges: Challenges is to find external contractors, teachers, coach teams to lead workshops
Activites.stakeholders: Possible project partners: Slovenian Employers' Association, Styrian Chamber of Commerce, Celje Regional Chamber of Commerce, Pomurje Chamber of Commerce, Savinjsko-šaleška Chamber of Commerce, Primorska Chamber of Commerce, Chamber of Commerce of Dolenjska and Bela krajina, Slovenian Journalists' Union

indicators.description: Questionnaires about progress (better exercise, weight loss, change in eating habits.

references.title: ZDS
NIJZ
Wellsteps
MIT
OKUSNO

Activites.keySuccessFactors: Easier for employees to get involved in activities if they have the opportunity to co-create them themselves

Activites.title: Personal Well-being: Aerobic and strength exercise program for people with depression and / or stress
Activites.needs: There is a global need to tackle depression that according ot WHO effect over 300 miljon people worldwide
Activites.challenges: Challenges is to reache people with disabilites.

indicators.description: Physical fitness that can be objectively measured e.g. Resting HR, Weight, ...

successStories.title: Meta-Analysis of exercise with depressive symtoms

Activites.title: Trail cycling for children and young people with neuropsychiatric disabilities
Activites.needs: There is need to find heart rate enhancing activity sutiable for young people with disabilites
Activites.challenges: Find sutiable leaders the have the time and experince to lead a young group of with neuropsychiatric disabilities, hence a free course for leading trail cycling
Activites.stakeholders: Cykelframjandet, Friluftsframjandet, The Autism and Asperger's Association, Attention

indicators.description: Self-reported well-being and movement behaviors (physical activity, sleep, screen time).

references.title: Børrestad LAB, Østergaard L, Andersen LB, Bere E. Experiences from a randomised, controlled trial on cycling to school: Does cycling increase cardiorespiratory fitness? Scandinavian Journal of Public Health. 2012;40(3):245-252. doi:10.1177/1403494812443606

Activites.keySuccessFactors: Trail cycling - It's a fun heart rate increasing activity that requrire focus

Activites.title: Psychical activity for people with type 2-diabetes propelled by social prescribing in general practice
Activites.needs: There is a need for developing interventions that can reduce physical inactivity, as people who are physically inactive are at increased risk for lifestyle diseases
Activites.challenges: The challenges is a lack of overview of initiatives in the local communities aimed at increasing physical activity
Activites.stakeholders: General practitioners (GPs), local community, Skødstrup lægeklinik

indicators.description: Numbers of referrals from the GP to patients in the local community and number of patients showing up to Equips activity.

references.title: Li J, Siegrist J. Physical activity and risk of cardiovascular disease--a meta-analysis of prospective cohort studies. Int J Environ Res Public Health. 2012;9(2):391-407

Activites.title: You can not stop people with disabilities
Activites.needs: Studies have shown that time in nature was found to have a positive effect on mood and aspects of cognitive function, including working memory, as well as a dampening effect on anxiety.
Activites.challenges: Finding motivated and well-trained person without disabilities. Support form the surrounding and family of person with disabilities, Funding.
Activites.stakeholders: Birell, Union of the Blind and Visually Impaired people of Slovakia, Organization of Muscular Dystrophies in SK

Activites.title: Love food and live healthy
Activites.needs: There is a need to practising sport and exercising safely (e.g: maintaining normal glucose levels during training) for people with type 1 diabetes
Activites.challenges: The awareness among health professionals of the importance of physical exercise for people with type 1 diabetes, as well as of the prevalence and consequences of psychological problems affecting adults with diabetes.
Activites.stakeholders: Fondazione Vodafone, CONI - Sport without borders Italy, Diabetes Study Group of the Italian Society of Paediatric Endocrinology – SIEDP, Italian National Association of Diabetic Athletes – ANIAD and Italian Ministry of Health

indicators.description: Evaluate the users’ perceived usefulness of the resources

Activites.title: Weekly fitness program for children and young adults with type 1 diabetes
Activites.targetGroup: children and young adults with type 1 diabetes
Activites.needs: Physical activity is one of the pillars in the treatment of diabetes and in the maintenance of a healthy lifestyle

Activites.title: Mens sana in corpore sano: A sound mind in a sound body
Activites.targetGroup: People with an occupational disease (such as depression and burnout)
Activites.needs: In Belgium, 62% of all workers suffer from excessive stress and 1/3 of the disability benefits in Belgium are due to mental problems.
Activites.challenges: Encourage employers to offer their employees the possibility to practice sports during working hours

references.title: Michael Craig Miller. (February 2021). Exercise is an all-natural treatment to fight depression
Van den Heuvel et al. (2003). Sporten, type werk, arbeidsverzuim en welbevinden: resultaten van een 3-jarige follow-up studie.
Amlani and Munir. (2014). Does physical activity have an impact on sickness absence? A review.
Gerber et al. (2013). Cardiorespiratory fitness protects against stress-related symptoms of burnout and depression.

Activites.keySuccessFactors: Workers really want to practice sports and having the opportunity to practice sports at the work floor or during working hours makes it happen
